title: Ticket #4403: Job rank may not always  work as documented - autoclustering bug
description:
There is a bug in how HTCondor performs autoclustering of job ads. All jobs that get assigned the same AutoClusterID job ad attribute by HTCondor are supposed to be identical for purposes of matchmaking. For background, see the autoclustering design document.

In the design document, it states

  "...the schedd augments the significant attributes received from the negotiator by adding the job’s Requirements and Rank attributes, as well as any job ClassAd attribute that is referenced by the job’s own Requirements or Rank expression."

Unfortunately, the autoclustering implementation fails to inspect the job's rank expression. This bug has existed since autoclustering was initially implemented back in the summer of the year 2006!

Demonstrating the Problem

Here is how I reproduced the issue - just in a personal v8.1.5 HTCondor on my Windows 7 laptop, here is what i added to my condor_config.local : 

NUM_CPUS = 5
STARTD_EXPRS = $(STARTD_EXPRS) MachineDataSet
SLOT1_MachineDataSet = "S00"
SLOT2_MachineDataSet = "S01"
SLOT3_MachineDataSet = "S02"
SLOT4_MachineDataSet = "S03"
SLOT5_MachineDataSet = "S04"

The above gives my test setup fives slots, were each slots advertises a unique MachineDataSet attribute

Next I submitted the following with condor_submit: 

executable = c:\utils\sleep.exe
transfer_executable = false
arguments = 6000
# For easy monitoring, take the MachineDataSet attribute from
# the slot we match with and add it into
# the job classad as attribute MachineAttrMachineDataSet0
job_machine_attrs = MachineDataSet
# Prefer slots where MachineDataSet attribute in the slot
# is equal to the JobDataSet attribute in the job
rank = JobDataSet =?= MachineDataSet
# Set JobDataSet to be S00, S01, S02, etc.
+JobDataSet = "S0$(Process)"
queue 5

And behold, jobs did not match up as expected based on the job rank expression: 

C:\condor\test>condor_submit lsst.sub
Submitting job(s).....
5 job(s) submitted to cluster 6971.

C:\condor\test>condor_q -af ProcId RemoteHost  JobDataSet MachineAttrMachineDataSet0 AutoClusterId
0 slot1@ToddsThinkpad S00 S00 44
1 slot5@ToddsThinkpad S01 S04 44
2 slot4@ToddsThinkpad S02 S03 44
3 slot2@ToddsThinkpad S03 S01 44
4 slot3@ToddsThinkpad S04 S02 44

A key thing to note in the above is all the jobs ended up with the same autoclusterid...

Immediate Workaround

Add a clause to the job requirements expression that will reference all attributes used in the job rank expression; an easy/foolproof way to do this is a clause like 

   requirements = Rank =!= UNDEFINED

And indeed, behold that when I add this requirements expression to the submit file above, jobs matched up on slots as expected: 

C:\condor\test>type lsst.sub
executable = c:\utils\sleep.exe
transfer_executable = false
arguments = 6000
job_machine_attrs = MachineDataSet
rank = JobDataSet =?= MachineDataSet
requirements = Rank =!= UNDEFINED
+JobDataSet = "S0$(Process)"
queue 5

C:\condor\test>condor_submit lsst.sub
Submitting job(s).....
5 job(s) submitted to cluster 6972.

C:\condor\test>condor_q -af ProcId RemoteHost  JobDataSet MachineAttrMachineDataSet0 AutoClusterId
0 slot1@ToddsThinkpad S00 S00 52
1 slot2@ToddsThinkpad S01 S01 53
2 slot3@ToddsThinkpad S02 S02 54
3 slot4@ToddsThinkpad S03 S03 55
4 slot5@ToddsThinkpad S04 S04 56

Note each job is in a different autoclusterid...
